ch.packzeugs.semproject.persistence

Class DataAccessMock

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.packzeugs.semproject.persistence.DataAccessMock

  • public class DataAccessMock
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class DataAccessMock represents a data access mock implementation to store data from persons (ie. customer, employees) as in-memory in a array.
    Version:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Pascal and David

    • Method Detail

      • savePerson

        public void savePerson(java.lang.String[] person)
        Save the persons data in the in-memory data storage.
        Parameters:
        person - the data of the person to insert to the in-memory.

      • readPerson

        public java.lang.String[] readPerson(int entryID)
        Read the data of one person from the in-memory data storage.
        Parameters:
        entryID - the id of the entry from which to return the persons data
        Returns:
        the data of the read person or in case of an error NULL.

      • readPersons

        public java.lang.String[][] readPersons()
        Read the data of all persons from the in-memory data storage.
        Returns:
        the string[][] data of all saved persons.

      • savePerson

        public void savePerson(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String surname)
        Save data of a person to the in-memory
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the person
        surname - the surname of the person
